column1: Tell me about Lady Ada Lovelace. What's her background?;"assistant: Lady Ada Lovelace (1815-1852) was a mathematician

column1: Ada was born Augusta Ada Byron

column3: Ada was raised in a strict and isolated environment.

column1: Despite these challenges

Ada met Charles Babbage
column3: the inventor of the proposed mechanical general-purpose computer
column4: the Analytical Engine. Babbage was impressed by her mathematical abilities and asked for her help in understanding and improving his machine. Ada worked with Babbage on the engine's design and wrote notes on its capabilities

column1: Ada's work on the Analytical Engine included a method for calculating Bernoulli numbers using the engine's punched cards. This work was well ahead of its time and demonstrated her understanding of the potential of machines to perform calculations automatically.
Throughout her life
column2: Ada struggled with mental health issues and personal relationships. She died at the age of 36 due to complications from cancer.

column1: Today
